intro: Anisophyllea meniaudii, commonly known as the Meniaud's anisophyllea, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often deeply lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbels, and it produces berries that are edible for some bird species. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
